name: Miniature Lupine, Annual lupine, Bicolored lupine
overview: They grow up to 8 cm tall. The plants are of value to pollinators, including native bees and bumble bees.
habitat: Native to western North America, from northwestern Baja California, throughout California, and north to British Columbia. It is found in grasslands; chaparral; oak, mixed conifer and Joshua tree woodlands; coastal sage scrub; and open conifer forests.
